summary: The documents provided are exhibit cover sheets related to investigations and record-keeping. Two of the cover sheets pertain to correspondence involving Kenneth C. Griggs and Philip LaChapelle Jr. in November 1967, indicating an inquiry or investigation involving Griggs around that time. The third cover sheet references a letter from the FBI regarding David Reed Fromer, born in 1942, and is part of a file maintained by the 113th Intelligence Corps Group. The cover sheets serve to document and organize exhibits within larger investigations or record collections. The dates of the cover sheets span from 1968 to 1996, suggesting ongoing documentation and review processes.
significance: Exhibit cover sheets are administrative documents used to catalog and manage evidence or related materials. Their significance lies in their role in organizing and tracking information relevant to investigations, in this case, potentially related to the JFK assassination or related inquiries. The presence of these cover sheets indicates that the associated documents were considered important enough to be formally included as exhibits within a larger investigation or collection of records.
